meanings.definition: A situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement; a deadlock.
meanings.sent1: The impasse in negotiations left both parties frustrated.
meanings.sent2: The impasse between the two countries led to a standstill in the peace talks.
meanings.sent3: The impasse over which movie to watch resulted in a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: Their impasse resembled two cars stuck in a traffic jam, unable to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The impasse felt like being trapped in a maze with no way out.

meanings.definition: A road or passage having no exit; a cul-de-sac.
meanings.sent1: The impasse at the end of the street forced drivers to turn around.
meanings.sent2: The impasse was so narrow that only one car could pass through at a time.
meanings.sent3: The impasse was like a dead-end in a video game, with no secret passage to escape.
meanings.sent4: The impasse looked like a forgotten path in the woods, leading nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The impasse appeared like a closed door in a long hallway, blocking further progress.
